error.signature: WorkflowScript: expected a step @ line 12, column 5
error.regex: (?:WorkflowScript.*expected|org\.codehaus\.groovy\.control\.MultipleCompilationErrorsException|No such DSL method|Invalid agent type|expected a step)

verdict.summary: Jenkins pipeline (Jenkinsfile) contains Groovy syntax errors, invalid DSL method calls, or structural issues. The pipeline fails during parsing before any stages execute.

dead_ends.action: Test Groovy syntax in an online Groovy compiler
dead_ends.why_fails: Jenkins Pipeline DSL is not standard Groovy; many pipeline-specific constructs (pipeline, stage, steps) are Jenkins-only and will fail in a regular Groovy compiler

dead_ends.action: Convert declarative pipeline to scripted pipeline to fix syntax errors
dead_ends.why_fails: Scripted pipeline is more complex and error-prone; switching paradigms mid-debug introduces new categories of errors

workarounds.action: Use the Jenkins Pipeline Syntax Snippet Generator and Replay feature
workarounds.how: Navigate to your Jenkins instance > Pipeline Syntax (available in job config). Use the Snippet Generator to build correct DSL snippets. Use Replay to test changes without committing

workarounds.action: Validate Jenkinsfile locally using the Jenkins Pipeline Linter
workarounds.how: Use 'curl -X POST -F 'jenkinsfile=<Jenkinsfile' http://JENKINS_URL/pipeline-model-converter/validate' to validate declarative pipeline syntax remotely, or use IDE plugins with pipeline linting

leads_to.condition: When fixing syntax reveals credential binding errors in the pipeline

preceded_by.condition: When agent comes back online and pipeline runs but has syntax issues from recent edits

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Jenkins uses Groovy-based Jenkinsfile syntax; GitHub Actions uses YAML workflow files
